title: Some commentators have distinguished between ‘teleological’ and ‘eutaxiological’ versions of the design argument. Only the first of these is said to depend on the identification of purpose in the world; the second rests simply on the observation of order, and the thought that such order is unlikely to have arisen by chance. Plainly, my approach will be more oriented towards the first version of the design argument, although as we have seen, the arguments from regularity and purpose are often difficult to distinguish
